problem.markdown:
1. A real protein is composed of () only alpha helix. () only beta sheet. () combination of alpha helix and beta sheet. (x) combination of all possible secondary structures.
2. CD spectrum of each individual secondary structures ______________ among themselves to form the CD spectrum of the real protein. (x) Convolute. () Deconvolute. () Rearrange. () Add up.
3. How to extract information of secondary structures from a real CD spectra of a protein? () It is never possible to get information about a particular secondary structure. () We need to have CD spectrum at different concentration of the protein. Then perform a statistical analysis. (x) Mathematically we can deconvolute the CD spectrum of a real protein. () Only for a few number of proteins it is possible not for all.
